item.title: 沙特-PIF 支持的麦加房地产开发商计划在当地上市
item.description: Umm Al Qura for Development & Construction Co.是穆斯林圣城麦加最大的项目之一，该项目背后的沙特阿拉伯公司计划在该国主要证券交易所进行首次公开募股。【原文：Umm Al Qura for Development & Construction Co., the Saudi Arabian firm behind one of the largest projects in the Muslim holy city of Mecca, plans to proceed with an initial public offering on the country’s main stock exchange.】

item.title: 特朗普关税重创汽车业，汽车价格将上涨 3,000 美元
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对加拿大和墨西哥征收的关税将威胁到北美地区汽车制造商的生产，并使创纪录的汽车价格进一步上涨，约四分之一万亿美元的贸易将受到干扰。【原文：President Donald Trump’s tariffs against Canada and Mexico will threaten production at automakers across North America and send record vehicle prices even higher, with about a quarter of a trillion dollars in trade set to be disrupted.】

item.title: 科威特预测下一财政年度将出现 63 亿第纳尔赤字
item.description: 据科威特国营通讯社（KUNA）周日报道，科威特大臣会议批准了从 4 月 1 日开始的财政年度国家预算，预算赤字为 63.06 亿第纳尔。【原文：Kuwait’s Council of Ministers approved the state budget for the fiscal year starting April 1 which sees a deficit of 6.306 billion dinars, the state-run KUNA news agency reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁发动贸易战，市场期待美元涨势延续
item.description: 在经历了数周由美国主导的贸易战风险之后，周一重新开市的金融市场需要面对现实。【原文：Having lived with the risk of a US-led trade war for weeks, financial markets reopen Monday needing to deal with the reality.】

item.title: 捷克总理希望降息步伐快于预期
item.description: 捷克总理彼得-菲亚拉（Petr Fiala）赞成在上月通胀数据显示经济反弹后加快货币宽松。【原文：Czech Prime Minister Petr Fiala favors faster monetary easing after last month’s inflation data suggested an economic rebound.】

item.title: 全球贸易即将经历关税压力测试
item.description: 大家好，周日快乐。在唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布对墨西哥和加拿大进口商品征收 25% 的关税，并对中国商品征收 10% 的进口税之后，我们为您带来本期《供应线》特别节目。进入周一后，报复和反应将继续发展。【原文：Hello and happy Sunday. We’re bringing you this special edition of Supply Lines after President Donald Trump announced that he’s going ahead with 25% tariffs on Mexican and Canadian imports, and a 10% import tax on Chinese goods. The story continues to develop with retaliation and reaction heading into Monday.】

item.title: 安大略省福特为应对关税将美国酒撤下货架
item.description: 加拿大最大的省份表示，作为对唐纳德-特朗普总统对加拿大进口商品征收 25% 关税的回应，该省将从政府经营的酒类商店中撤下美国产品。【原文：Canada’s biggest province said it will remove American products from its government-run liquor stores as part of its response to President Donald Trump’s 25% tariffs on Canadian imports.】

item.title: 欧盟警告美国，如果特朗普对商品征收关税，欧盟将进行报复
item.description: 欧盟表示，如果美国对欧盟征收关税，欧盟将 "坚决回应"，这是欧盟对唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易策略表示不满的最新迹象。【原文：The European Union has said it will “respond firmly” if the US imposes tariffs on the bloc in the latest sign of discontent with President Donald Trump’s trade tactics that are reverberating globally.】

item.title: 特朗普对中国征收 10%关税后，习近平考虑采取报复措施
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普挑起新一轮贸易战之后，加拿大和墨西哥领导人急忙做出回应，而中国国家主席习近平在宣布任何具体的报复措施之前，先喘了一口气。【原文：As the leaders of Canada and Mexico rushed to respond after Donald Trump started a new trade war, Chinese President Xi Jinping took a breath before his nation announced any concrete retaliation.】

item.title: 意大利联合信贷银行在意大利最新交易中获得 Generali 4% 的股份
item.description: 意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）获得了 Assicurazioni Generali SpA 的少数股权，为意大利金融业的交易添上了浓墨重彩的一笔。【原文：UniCredit SpA built a minority equity stake in Assicurazioni Generali SpA, adding to a flurry of dealmaking in the Italian financial sector.】

item.title: 美元和美联储前景黯淡，新兴市场债务希望破灭
item.description: 由于美元走强和美国一系列关税措施，基金经理们重新考虑了他们对发展中资产的主要押注之一。【原文：What started as a promising year for emerging-market local debt is quickly souring as a strong dollar and a barrage of US tariffs have fund managers rethinking one of their main bets for developing assets.】

item.title: 伊拉克议会解除库尔德石油长期薪酬纠纷
item.description: 伊拉克议会通过了一项期待已久的计划，以增加对库尔德斯坦半自治地区石油公司的付款，这是向恢复该地区近两年前停止的出口迈出的一步。【原文：Iraq’s parliament passed a long-awaited plan to boost payments to oil companies in the semi-autonomous Kurdistan region, a step toward resuming exports from the area that were halted almost two years ago.】

item.title: 澳大利亚房价在悉尼和墨尔本的带动下进一步下跌
item.description: 由于墨尔本-堪培拉-悉尼三角区的购房者发现自己越来越多地被挤出了这些市场，而降息的前景又在加强，澳大利亚的房价在 1 月份进一步下滑。【原文：Australian house prices slid further in January as buyers in the triangle of Melbourne-Canberra-Sydney found themselves increasingly priced out of those markets, just as prospects strengthen for an interest-rate cut.】

item.title: 苹果在人工智能和增强现实技术上的挣扎表明其产品优势已有所丧失
item.description: 苹果公司在人工智能和增强现实等新兴领域的挣扎表明，该公司已经失去了一些产品开发优势。此外：苹果公司将推出邀请服务；尽管中国市场大幅放缓，但该公司季度营收仍创历史新高；SpaceX 的 Starlink 服务将面向 T-Mobile iPhone 用户。【原文：Apple’s struggles in emerging areas like artificial intelligence and augmented reality show the company has lost some of its product development edge. Also: Apple is set to launch an invite service; the company reports record-high quarterly revenue despite a big slowdown in China; and SpaceX’s Starlink service is coming to T-Mobile iPhone customers.】

item.title: 特朗普的新关税闪电战将打击鳄梨、汽车和甜椒
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普即将对来自加拿大和墨西哥的商品征收 25% 的关税，对来自中国的产品征收 10% 的关税，这些关税将波及千家万户，提高包括蔬菜、水果和汽车在内的各种商品的价格。【原文：President Donald Trump’s upcoming 25% tariffs on goods from Canada and Mexico and 10% duties on products from China are set to ricochet through households, raising prices for a wide range of items including vegetables, fruits and cars.】

item.title: 避免保护主义，印度向工业界发出削减关税的信号
item.description: 印度财政部长周日表示，在美国对其邻国和中国征收关税之际，印度削减一系列商品进口关税的举措是一个信号，表明工业界不能指望政府采取保护主义措施。【原文：India’s move to slash import duties on a slew of items is a signal that industry can’t count on protectionist measures from the government, the nation’s finance secretary said on Sunday, amid US slapping tariffs on its neighbors and China.】

item.title: 结称欧洲央行通胀目标可期，允许放开利率刹车
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员克拉斯-克诺（Klaas Knot）表示，消费者价格增长恢复到欧洲中央银行的目标，将使决策者能够停止通过利率限制经济增长。【原文：Consumer-price growth returning to the European Central Bank’s target will allow policymakers to stop restricting economic growth via its interest rates, according to Governing Council member Klaas Knot.】

item.title: 迪拜新增价值 1 亿美元的豪宅，吸引全球超级富豪的目光
item.description:
迪拜的房地产公司正争先恐后地吸引更多来自欧洲、亚洲和美洲的买家

。【原文：

Real-estate firms in Dubai are scrambling to attract more buyers from Europe, Asia and the Americas

】

item.title: 阿联酋阿德诺克公司（Adnoc）欲收购新星化学公司，与 OMV 达成交易
item.description: 阿布扎比国家石油公司（Abu Dhabi National Oil Co.）和能源生产商 OMV AG 正在考虑收购加拿大新星化学公司（Nova Chemicals Corp.【原文：Abu Dhabi National Oil Co. and energy producer OMV AG are considering buying Canada’s Nova Chemicals Corp. and rolling it into an industry giant they’re seeking to create by merging two companies in which they have cross shareholdings.】

item.title: 香港上市中资股应对特朗普关税影响
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普打响关税战第一枪后，在香港上市的中国股市在休市三个交易日后于周一恢复交易时将再次面临压力。【原文：Chinese stocks listed in Hong Kong will come under renewed pressure when they resume trading on Monday following a three-session break, after US President Donald Trump fired the first salvo of his tariff war.】

item.title: 土耳其通胀可能缓解，推动中央银行的发展道路
item.description: 今年年初，土耳其的年通货膨胀率可能降至 41.2%，这让政策制定者在推进降息时吃了一颗定心丸。【原文：Turkey’s annual inflation probably eased to 41.2% at the start of the year, giving policymakers reassurance as they push forward with interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 能源储备恢复，南非暂停电力削减
item.description: 南非国家电力公司 Eskom 以恢复应急储备为由，暂停了周五开始的轮流停电。【原文：South Africa’s state power utility Eskom has suspended rotational blackouts that started Friday, citing a recovery of emergency reserves.】

item.title: 沙特在线经纪商 Derayah 在利雅得首次公开募股中募集 4 亿美元资金
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的 Derayah 金融公司将从首次公开募股中募集多达 15 亿里亚尔（约合 4 亿美元）的资金，这将拉开沙特阿拉伯王国今年股票销售旺季的序幕。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Derayah Financial Co. will seek as much as 1.5 billion riyals ($400 million) from an initial public offering, kicking off what is expected to be a busy year for share sales in the kingdom.】

item.title: 印度经济增长蹒跚，莫迪支持中产阶级而非失业者
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）在预算中为印度中产阶级大幅减税，以缓解经济在全球逆风中的压力，但对去年投票反对他的数百万失业者却没有提供什么直接支持。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave India’s middle classes significant tax relief in his budget to cushion the economy against global headwinds, but provided little direct support to the millions of unemployed who voted against him last year.】

item.title: 特朗普关税针对中国网络零售商利用的漏洞
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对中国、加拿大和墨西哥的新贸易征税包括对电子商务的大举进攻，显然计划取消对价值低于 800 美元的包裹长期实行的关税豁免。【原文：President Donald Trump’s new trade levies against China, Canada and Mexico include a broadside against e-commerce, with apparent plans to extinguish a long-held tariff exemption for packages worth less than $800.】

item.title: 印尼可能在即将出台的规则中设定社交媒体使用年龄限制
item.description: 印度尼西亚可能会对社交媒体的使用设定年龄限制，作为即将出台的保护儿童免受网上有害内容侵害的法规的一部分。【原文：Indonesia may set an age limit on social media use as part of upcoming regulations to protect children from harmful content online.】

item.title: 中国誓言采取措施反击美国关税，威胁 WTO 行动
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布对来自世界第二大经济体的进口商品征收 10%的关税后，中国政府誓言将对美国采取不明确的 "相应反制措施"。【原文：The Chinese government vowed to take unspecified “corresponding countermeasures” against the US, after President Donald Trump announced a 10% tariff on imports from the world’s No. 2 economy.】

item.title: 美国铝业敦促特朗普豁免加拿大关税
item.description: 美国铝业呼吁唐纳德-特朗普总统将加拿大进口的金属原材料从其计划的关税中豁免，以帮助保护就业和国内制造商。【原文：The US aluminum industry called on President Donald Trump to exempt Canadian imports of the raw metal from his planned tariffs to help protect jobs and domestic manufacturers.】

item.title: 特朗普新关税计划的目标是什么？
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统在竞选期间曾承诺在其第二任总统任期内将进口税重新置于美国经济政策的中心位置。特朗普签署命令，对从加拿大和墨西哥进口的商品征收 25% 的全面关税，对从中国进口的商品征收 10% 的全面关税。关税将于 2 月 4 日星期二上午 12:01 开始生效。【原文：After promising during his election campaign to put import taxes back at the center of US economic policy during his second term as president, President Donald Trump took a dramatic step in that direction on Feb. 1. Trump signed orders imposing across-the-board tariffs of 25% on imports from Canada and Mexico and 10% from China. The tariffs will take effect at 12:01 am on Tuesday, Feb. 4.】

item.title: 彻底背叛"：特朗普关税冲击主要贸易关系，加拿大深感不安
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统签署行政命令，对美国从加拿大进口的几乎所有商品征收 25% 的关税，并对能源征收 10% 的关税后，加拿大做好了经济动荡的准备，并开始采取报复性贸易措施。【原文：Canada braced for economic turmoil and began rolling out retaliatory trade measures after President Donald Trump signed an executive order imposing 25% tariffs on almost everything the US imports from the country, and 10% on energy.】
